Package database

Class ReadWriteDao<I extends WithID>

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.ReadWriteDao<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - The class of items to which the DAO provides access
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppointmentDao, CustomerDao
    public abstract class ReadWriteDao<I extends WithID>
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class of DAOs that provide read and write access to a class of items in the database. Each item has an associated ID and getters/setters for the ID. This base class generically implements a number of database operations that are common to items having unique IDs, relying on the implementations of the abstract methods createItem() and loadStatement() to tailor the queries.
    Author:
    Joseph T. Lapp

      • ReadWriteDao

        public ReadWriteDao​(java.sql.Connection conn,
                    User user,
                    java.lang.String itemName,
                    java.lang.String tableName,
                    java.lang.String idColumnName,
                    java.lang.String orderByColumnName)
             throws DatabaseException
        Constructs a DAO providing read/write access to a table containing a class of items.
        Parameters:
        conn - An open database connection, which it leaves open
        user - The logged-in user
        itemName - English term for the class of items
        tableName - Name of the database table
        idColumnName - Name of the primary key column
        orderByColumnName - Name of column by which to order table, or null to leave unordered
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - on database error

      • save

        public void save​(I item)
          throws DatabaseException
        Write the provided item to the database. If the item has an ID of 0, the item is added to the database and given the ID that the database automatically assigns to it. If the ID is non-zero, updates the item.
        Parameters:
        item - Item to write to the database
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - on database error

      • delete

        DatabaseException - on database error

      • close

        public void close()
           throws DatabaseException
        Closes any open resources in this DAO, but does not close the database connection, allowing the connection to be shared with other DAOs for faster processing of a sequence of operations.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - on database error

        Returns:

      • getUpdateStatement

        protected abstract java.sql.PreparedStatement getUpdateStatement()
        Returns an update statement prepared for the class of items. The last parameter of this prepared statement must take an ID.
        Returns:
        An insert statement for the class of items
